title: 45 Best Gifts for Husbands 2019
text:
45 items in this article 12 items on sale! Photo: Courtesy ABC

It can be tough to find new gifts for the main man in your life year after year. If you’ve already exhausted all of your own ideas, we’re here to help. Because all husbands are different — maybe yours is a passionate home cook, a lawn-game enthusiast, or a business traveler — we’ve rounded up picks for all types of guys with all types of interests. Even if your husband claims he doesn’t want or need anything, one of these gifts (drawn mostly from our archive of useful and delightful products) will surely be appreciated. Plus, they’re all available on Amazon for your one-click convenience.

For the husband who travels for work

Paravel Packing Cube Trio This handsome set of space-saving packing cubes will keep his suitcase organized. A clear window on each cube lets him see what’s inside without digging through them all to find a pair of socks. $55 at Amazon Buy $55 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who travels for pleasure

Photo: Courtesy of the retailer Atlas Obscura: An Explorer’s Guide to the World’s Hidden Wonders, by Joshua Foer, Dylan Thuras, and Ella Morton $20 (was $35, now 43% off) Even if he’s been everywhere, he’ll definitely find a new destination to add to his bucket list in this compendium of off-the-beaten-path attractions around the world. Note: The Barnes & Noble version comes with a bonus poster of Mexico’s Cave of Swallows; the second edition is currently available for preorder. $20 at Amazon Buy $32 at Barnes & Noble Buy

For the husband who’s more of a homebody

John Christian Men’s Hooded Fleece Robe We get it: Sometimes you just want to spend quality time on the couch. And we can’t think of anything better to wear while lounging than this fleece bathrobe that one Amazon reviewer calls “very luxurious-feeling.” $37 at Amazon Buy $37 at Amazon Buy

For the husband (and spouse) who are both homebodies

For the husband who’s skin-care curious

For the husband who already follows the Dewy Dudes

Algenist Complete Eye Renewal Balm $51 (was $68, now 25% off) Round out his routine with this eye cream recommended by Emilio Quezada, co-founder of the skincare-for-guys podcast and Instagram account. “For the fellas out there looking for a break from the tired-eyes look, the Algenist Complete Renewal Balm is worth every penny,” he says. $51 at Amazon Buy $68 at Sephora Buy

For the husband who’s a new dad

Kicking Horse Coffee, Dark Roast, Whole Bean A full night’s sleep might be a thing of the past, but a strong cup of this dark-roast brew will give him the energy he needs to make it through the day. As one satisfied Amazon reviewer writes, “If you like coffee that kicks you in the butt, this is that coffee.” $8 at Amazon Buy $8 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who’s a cat dad

For the husband who’s a plant dad

For the husband who aspires to be a plant dad

Costa Farms Premium Live Indoor Snake Plant Since it’s notoriously easy to keep alive, the snake plant — or sansevieria — is often recommended as a good starter plant. As one shop owner told us, it’s “pretty much indestructible,” so “it builds someone’s confidence and makes sure they’re gonna be set up for success.” This one even comes in a planter. $38 at Amazon Buy $38 at Amazon Buy

For the commuter husband

For the husband who drinks iced coffee year round

For the husband looking to spice things up (in the kitchen)

Photo: Flatiron Books Bottom of the Pot: Persian Recipes and Stories, by Naz Deravian In her collection of Persian recipes, chef Naz Deravian inspires the home cook to embrace new flavors. As our friends at Grub Street say, “if this book doesn’t convince you to immediately run out and buy pomegranate molasses, orange-blossom water, barberries, dried rose petals, and musir, you might as well hang up your apron and call it a day.” $20 at Amazon Buy $20 at Amazon Buy

For the husband looking to spice things up (in the bedroom)

Überlube Luxury Lubricant Packaged in a surprisingly tasteful glass bottle, this fancy lube is one of our readers’ favorites. We learned about it from Samantha Bard, co-owner of Brooklyn-based Shag, who says it’s “one the highest-quality silicone lubes out there.” $18 at Amazon Buy $18 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who’s the neighborhood cornhole champ

For the husband who spends weekends hiking on trails

For the husband who spends weekends running on trails

Salomon Agile 12 Set Trail runners know the struggle of finding a backpack that holds their essentials (water, Clif bar, windbreaker for suddenly changing weather) and doesn’t bounce around when you’re navigating tough terrain. Writer and experienced runner Steven John says this one can stand up to high-intensity runs and races. $110 at Amazon Buy $110 at Backcountry Buy

For the husband whose work shoes have seen better days

Johnston & Murphy Men's Melton Cap-Toe Shoe Beloved by reviewers, these snazzy dress shoes are as comfortable as they are classic. One fan writes, “You will be surprised at how comfortable they are. I can wear them for hours with no issues.” From $165 at Amazon Buy From $165 at Amazon Buy

For the husband with no matching socks

For the husband who prefers socks with personality

For the husband toting his college-era backpack to work

For the husband who likes an old-fashioned shave

For the husband who would rather leave some stubble

Philips Norelco Beard Trimmer Series 7200 Vacuum Trimmer $55 (was $60, now 8% off) For guys who prefer a little facial hair, this beard trimmer has been a perennial Strategist best seller since writer Kurt Soller raved about its “convenient radial dial that lets you easily choose lengths as short 0.5 mm (and in 0.5 mm increments up from there) … [and its] vacuum-suction feature that collects the majority of your shaven hairs.” $55 at Amazon Buy $55 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who’s always jotting down his great ideas

For the husband who likes to tinker

Robotime DIY Wooden Submarine Puzzle 3D Laser-Cut Music Box We included a kids’ version of this 3-D puzzle in our roundup of the best wooden toys, but this grown-up style is way more elaborate, with components to assemble a built-in music box. $29 at Amazon Buy $29 at Amazon Buy

For the husband with a lot of patience

For the husband with a sweet tooth

For the husband who lost his gloves last winter

For the husband who can’t stay under the covers

For the husband who always borrows your lip balm

For the husband who hates putting on sunscreen

Supergoop! Super Power Sunscreen Mousse With Blue Seakale He’ll be much more likely to use a spray-on sunscreen than a greasy one that’s hard to rub in. We crowned this Supergoop! mousse the easiest to apply because it “isn’t sticky like lotion, absorbs on the spot, and provides full coverage.” $34 at Amazon Buy $34 at Supergoop! Buy

For the husband who keeps the house spotless

Drillbrush Bathroom Surfaces Cleaning Kit Builder discovered this unlikely tool for giving her bathroom a deep clean. A power-tool attachment, the Drillbrush erases years of built-up grime and soap scum. $15 at Amazon Buy $15 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who makes you breakfast in bed

For the husband who wants to host the next Super Bowl party

For the husband who wants to host the next Oscars party

Royal Doulton Tapas Bowls $40 (was $41, now 2% off) It’s too early to predict what films will be up for the big awards, but we can predict that the hours-long ceremony will leave your guests hungry for snacks. Fill up these coordinating tapas bowls for convenient noshing. $40 at Amazon Buy $40 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who likes to break out the bubbly

For the husband who likes to break out the bubbly (water)

Aarke Stainless-Steel Sparkling-Water Maker Kick his canned-seltzer habit with this eye-catching Swedish sparkling-water maker that we rated the best of the bunch. Note: The Aarke will be back in stock on Amazon on September 28. $199 at Amazon Buy $199 at Amazon Buy

For the husband sensitive to smells

Voluspa Mokara Scalloped-Edge Glass Candle If he turns up his nose at your fancy candles, try this one recommended by Strategist beauty writer Rio Viera-Newton, who has a sensitive nose herself. She says it’s “light and airy and a more subtle, floral experience” compared with more overpowering scents. $22 at Amazon Buy $22 at Amazon Buy

For the husband whose jeans are falling apart

For the husband who’s a headphone snob

Sony Noise-Canceling Headphones WH1000XM3 $348 (was $350, now 1% off) If he thinks his Bose noise-canceling headphones are great, wait until he tries this Sony pair that tech columnist David Pogue thinks is even better. They offer 30 hours of battery life (ten more than the Bose) and, according to Pogue, just “sound better.” $348 at Amazon Buy $348 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who listens to Reply All at the gym

AfterShokz Trekz Titanium headphones On the other hand, if he wants a pair that lets him listen to podcasts or music on the treadmill, these use a new technology that transmits sound through the bones in your ears. They come recommended by a professional runner. $80 at Amazon Buy $80 at AfterShokz Buy

For the husband with a bad back

Office Star Ergonomically Designed Knee Chair $84 (was $185, now 55% off) Writer Alice Gregory turned us on to this kneeling chair as an alternative to the standard desk chair that’s probably contributing to his bad posture. “Unlike a regular chair, the shape forces you to engage your core and naturally keeps your spine upright,” she says. “Your back muscles strengthen, and circulation improves.” $84 at Amazon Buy $84 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who just wants a massage

Etekcity Back Neck Massager with Heat Function This heated electric massager has quite the following in L.A. — probably because of its powerful knobs, which writer Natalie Toren says feel like “real human fists” kneading your tired muscles. $30 at Amazon Buy $30 at Amazon Buy

For the husband who buys a $5 umbrella every time it rains

AmazonBasics Automatic Travel Small Compact Umbrella With Wind Vent If he’s always getting caught without an umbrella, gift him one he can stash in his bag or at his desk. We like that this one is affordable but much more durable than one he’d buy from a street vendor. Strategist editor Alexis Swerdloff says the wind vent “makes it much less likely that the umbrella will flip.” $17 at Amazon Buy $17 at Amazon Buy

description: We rounded up the best gifts for husbands that’ll appeal to all types of guys, including skin care from Neutrogena and Algenist, Levi’s jeans, socks from Happy Socks and Hanes, Filson bags, Moleskine journals, Philips beard trimmers, and more.
